content.description: Chossy jugs lead to a reachy 1-2 move crux before finishing on a slopey ledge.
content.location: Furthest left on the main Simian wall.

content.description: Start this route by pulling a slight bulge into a vague scoop/dihedral 10 feet up. Navigate the many options for holds through another bulge. Continue up the vertical wall for another few bolts to the chains.
content.location: Just about the middle of the crag. 4th route right of pictograph.

content.description: Follow pockets up a gray streak on a vertical face up to a scoop just above and left of the last bolt. The crux is figuring out where the anchors are too far up over the bulge to the right of where you will inevitably follow the features after the last bolt.
content.protection: 5 bolts and hidden anchors with very short chain directly bolted to the rock
content.location: First route on the left of the right-side sector at Simian Complex. Look for the large dark hueco. This route is just to the left of it.

content.description: Start by clipping the low bolt and head up right.   After the 3rd bolt, traverse left and then head straight up to the chains.   The crux is approaching the 5th bolt.   Nice climbing!   Good warm up.
content.location: This is the RIGHT most route on the Simian Complex wall.

content.description: This routes has great sequences!   You might want to stick clip the first bolt as it protects the crux.    Start in the orange rock to the right of the line.  Climb up using crimps and layback edges (crux), until you can traverse above the first bolt to reach the 2nd.  From here, it's straight up to a bulge and 3rd bolt.   Pull the bulge on the left and move back right to the anchors.   For only 3 bolts, they are exactly where you want them.
content.location: This is the second line from the right on this wall.

content.description: Lots of sharp crimps drifting to the right then up past a couple of fairly run out bolts to the anchors
content.location: Second route from the far left of the Simian Complex (on the left-side sector)

content.description: Clip green bolt and brace yourself for a Wild Ride. Fancy footwork and big moves will take ya to the chains. Fantastic climbing on primo tan and gray limestone. A great addition to the crag.
content.location: Far right side of crag. Looks for a green bolt.

content.description: Crux off the deck to a low first bolt through to the second bolt. A couple of extra sections to work through as you move through the remainder of the route. 4th and 5th bolts may be a bit reachy for less than tall climbers.
content.location: Simian Complex is in two distinct sectors, a left side and a right side of the wall. Blue Baboon is the second from the right-most route of the left-sector of the wall. It is immediately left of the Santa Clara Warm-Up route.

content.description: Work up into the overhang and make a few deadpoints to positive holds to reach an orange scoop.   Climb up the edge of the scoop to gain a stance and clip the 5th bolt (crux).  Continue to the top on sharp holds with good footholds throughout.
content.location: Just to the left of the pictograph.

content.description: Start up the slight pillar, pulling through a slight bulge on jugs. Continue up the vertical wall on jugs as the wall gets steeper and the holds get smaller right up to the anchor. A nice juggy warm up to a V1-ish boulder problem at the end.
content.protection: 6 bolts to long chain anchors with lowering carabiners.
content.location: In the center of the crag, where the wall is less steep than other areas. It starts up a semi-detached looking 10 foot tall block.
